rules: Rule1: Provided that the platform is accessible to the developer at the work portal, the facility at the main office is accessible to the developer.

Rule2: If the developer has signed a contract for project alpha, then either security clearance is granted to the developer, or under the condition that a job is available for the developer on project alpha, the platform at the work portal is accessible to the developer.
Rule3: Should work be disrupted for the developer, technical issues arise for the developer.
Rule4: If work is disrupted for the developer, then it is not the case that the deadline for project alpha is met.
Rule5: Provided that the developer has technical issues, connectivity problems occur for the developer.
Rule6: If the project manager intervenes with the developer, then whenever connectivity problems occur for the developer, the deadline for project alpha is met.
Rule7: In the event that the system performs automated recovery for the developer, then if the developer has connectivity problems, the deadline for project alpha is met.
Rule8: Either facility access is granted to the developer at the main office, or platform access is granted to the developer at the work portal.
Rule9: If the project manager calls an emergency meeting, then the developer is reassigned to a team.
Rule10: Either the project manager calls an emergency meeting, or the project manager intervenes with the developer, or the system performs automated recovery for the developer.
Rule11: Provided that the developer's contract is terminated, the company initiates legal action against the developer.
Rule12: If the developer's contract is terminated, then it is not the case that the company initiates legal action against the developer.
Rule13: Under the condition that platform access is granted to the developer at the work portal, either the developer is assigned to project alpha, or generic work is available for the developer.

Rule14: Whenever work on project alpha is completed by the developer, then if facility access is granted to the developer at the main office, either the developer is assigned to project alpha, or generic work is available for the developer.
Rule15: Given that remote work is approved for the developer, work on project alpha is completed by the developer.
Rule16: Either remote work is approved for the developer, or on-site work is required for the developer.
Rule17: Should on-site work be required for the developer, payment is processed for the developer.
Rule18: Either technical support is available to the developer, or if on-site work is required for the developer, work on project alpha is completed by the developer.
Rule19: Whenever the facility at the main office is accessible to the developer, either the developer is assigned to project alpha, or generic work is available for the developer.
Rule20: If it is not the case that payment being processed for the developer implies work on project alpha is completed by the developer, then work is disrupted for the developer.
Rule21: Should work on project alpha not be completed by the developer, the developer's contract is terminated.
facts: Fact1: The developer has signed a contract for project alpha.
Fact2: A job is available for the developer on project alpha.
Fact3: It is not the case that the developer is assigned to project alpha.
Fact4: Security clearance is not granted to the developer.
Fact5: The developer is not reassigned to a team.
Fact6: Technical support is not available to the developer.

question: Generic work is available for the developer.
